item.title: Computer mouse locker/mover-multiple features!
item.dc:creator: @Weibs Weibs
item.description:
@Weibs wrote:

I interpreted it as the script would move the mouse to keep people from the using it and/or keep you from logging out. I was just pointing out that the dimensions do matter because the mouse could get stuck off to the side, but, I guess that would also keep people from using the mouse,

item.description:
@geel9 wrote:

THANK YOU!! I was looking everywhere for those!!! Hellfish, client dimensions don’t matter. it’s just moving the mouse…lol. I don’t get why people have to complicate everything when there is a much easier way.

item.title: Computer mouse locker/mover-multiple features!
item.dc:creator: @Hellfish Hellfish
item.description:
@Hellfish wrote:

You could use this instead:

[scar]Procedure CrazyMouse;
Var k : Integer;
Begin
// Get your clients dimensions.
GetClientDimensions(x2, y2);
// For k equals 1 to 10 do this…
For k := 1 to 10 do
Begin
// Move mouse randomly
MoveMouse(Random(x2), Random(y2));
// Add 1 to k each time until it equals 10.
k := k + 1;
End;
End;[/scar]

Read full topic

item.title: Computer mouse locker/mover-multiple features!
item.dc:creator: @geel9 geel9
item.description:
@geel9 wrote:

This allows you to
a):if you have a computer that logs off due to inactivity, put this on and boom! you won’t log off when you must go somewhere.
b):win bets
c):locks the computer
this is my second script, please post fairly. my first was just “writeln” junk.
[scar]program movemouse;
////////////////////////////////////////////
// press CTRL+ALT+S to stop it!
//created by:geel9
//copyright:no-one (copies allowed, I don’t care.)
//thanks to:the stickied tut. I LUB YOU!
procedure move;
begin
movemouse (689, 52)
wait(500)
movemouse (1007, 487)
wait(500)
movemouse (337, 488)
wait(500)
movemouse (689, 52)
end;
begin
writeln (‘your feature presentation will appear after this short message’)
wait(500)
writeln (‘important!!! press ctrl+alt+s to stop the mouse!!!’)
wait(2000)
writeln (‘if you do not, you will never control the mouse!!!’)
wait(2000)
writeln (‘if you like this script, please go to the following url.’)
wait(2000)
writeln (‘www.freewebs.com/trol/’)
wait(2000)
writeln (‘we are a runescape clan, but NO runescape scripts are posted!’)
wait(5000)
cleardebug;
writeln (‘press ctrl+alt+s to control the mouse!!!’)
repeat
move;
until(false)
end.[/scar]

for the locking one, and the bet one (aka bet that another person can’t move the mouse) do this.
[scar]program movemouse;
////////////////////////////////////////////
//created by:geel9
//copyright:no-one (copies allowed, I don’t care.)
//thanks to:the stickied tut. I LUB YOU!
procedure move;
begin
movemouse (689, 52)
wait(500)
movemouse (1007, 487)
wait(500)
movemouse (337, 488)
wait(500)
end;
begin
getself.hide;
repeat
move;
until(false)
end.[/scar]
